```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(readxl)
library(tidyverse)
library(tibble)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r load_data, echo=FALSE}
resq_data <- read_excel("resq-raw-data/sample_hospital.xlsx")

resq_tibble<-tribble(
~department_type, ~DeptTypeStr, ~hospitalized_in, ~hospital_days, ~stroke_type, ~nihss, ~nihss_score, ~ct_mri, ~ct_time, ~recanalization_procedures, ~dysphagia_screening, ~afib_flutter, ~antithrombotics, ~statin, ~smoking_cessation, ~antihypertensive, ~discharge_destination, ~discharge_mrs, ~discharge_date, ~door_to_needle, ~door_to_groin,
  1, "neurology", NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, 
  2,  "neurosurgery", NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, 
  3,  "anesthesiology/resusccitation/critical care department", NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, 
  4,  "internal medicine", NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, 
  5,  "geriatrics", NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, 
  6,  "other", NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, 
) 

resq_merge <- resq_tibble %>%
  group_by(department_type) %>%
  left_join(resq_data, resq_tibble, by=c("department_type"))
```
